intro: Astragalus leibergii, commonly known as Leiberg's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish to pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Astragalus leibergii is often found in steppes and desert environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
